item.title: Trolleys, old pans, pumpkins, beer cans, 10th December
item.description:
Trolleys, old pans, pumpkins, and beer cans have been left here for weeks. The metal Aldi trolley is a hazard, and the abandoned pans are a hazard for children walking along the path.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Newhaven Gardens, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping at same hot spot side of Candy Box Maple Crescent, 10th December
item.description:
Less than 24 hours of reporting flytipped items at this location and it promptly being removed thank you. Two plastic sacks full of rubbish have been dumped at the same location This has become a hot spot for flytipping. There is CCTV at the Candy Box that covers this area perhaps enforcement officers could make some enquiries in order to catch those responsible for blighting the neighbourhood. Please can the latest rubbish bags be removed please. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Maple Crescent, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter thrown around, 10th December
item.description:
Litter including bottles, cans, vape packets, cigarette packets discarded and strewn up and down Faversham Road, no doubt from purchases at the shop on the corner. The street requires daily, thorough cleaning on the street cleaning rota.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Faversham Road, Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Two large leather sofas have been dumped on the footpath outsude 46 Combedale Road Greenwich SE10 0LG, 10th December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Combedale Road, Greenwich

item.description:

item.title: Two blocked roadside gullies, 10th December
item.description:
There are two roadside gullies on the east side of the upper part of Point Hill. Both are full of leaves, but for the moment there are no cars parked over them. They have also been marked with yellow No Parking cones. No doubt someone wishing to park will move them soon, so if there is a gulley-cleaning machine in the neighbourhood, please direct it here!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Point Hill, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet
